newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sets 35 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sets 35 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.

text.p: The Central Bank of Venezuela announced for Wednesday morning a 15 billion bolivar ($32 million) auction of 179-day "monetary stabilization," or TEM, bills with a 21.62 percent coupon.
The bank said it would also offer ten billion bolivars ($21 million) in 269-day bills with a 22.20 percent coupon, and another ten billion bolivars of 358-day bills with a 22.79 percent coupon.
No TEMs are due to mature this week.

Coupons are also down from last week's 35 billion bolivar issue when 179-, 269- and 358-day notes carried 24.18, 24.90 and 25.64 coupons respectively for effective yields of 21.62, 23.31 and 25.28 percent.
The weekly TEM bill auctions are the Central Bank's principal tool of monetary policy, used to restrict liquidity and establish a benchmark for wider interest rates.
